intro: Dryadella yupanki, commonly known as the Andean flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from red to orange in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Dryadella yupanki is adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in cool, high-altitude regions with well-drained soil.
